message: Our job posting is a bit ugly, but here's the link:  http://careers.ama.ab.ca/postings/web-developer.  We're looking for a dev that's got 5+ years of coding under his or her belt (including non-Ruby code) and can help make our dev team better.  While AMA is a great place to work and offers a lot of benefits, my favourite perks are free parking, free coffee and low BS.  Ask questions here or drop me a line at mike@sideline.ca.

Hey folks - the dev team that I manage at AMA is hiring a dev to join our small Ruby team.  We work with Rails 3.0.x (but soon 3.1) in Ruby 1.8.7 (but soon 1.9) using MySql (but debating Postgres).  We manage our own servers (using Chef and Backup gems) and deploy constantly (relying on Capistrano, Jenkins and git).  We're as agile (with a small "a") as you can get, right down to the whiteboards and index cards.  We're growing and want someone to come and grow with us.

(Also working at AMA) I will attest to the good environment, fun team, and nearly limitless opportunity for your wild and interesting ideas to make it into (or become) final products. There are very few barriers between idea and execution.  

Not mentioned in the job posting: great education/conference opportunities, 3 weeks vacation is standard, we do very few meetings, and there's a lot of room/encouragement to chase new paths within your craft.
Have you guys found anyone yet?
@MarkBennett The position doesn't close until the 22nd.  We've had some good applicants but always looking for more.
